column4: im trying to install the wifi drivers in 11.04 and following the tutorial at http://bit.ly/iXGWEt but im stuck at step 5. "Run Administration -> Update manager" where is Administration on 11.04??
run it through the menu.  It will ask for a password.  After entering the password you are on 'administrator'  in the linux world it is called root
which menu do I run it through sorry?
Are you on 11.04  ??  Then it's in the unity bar
yes im runing 11.04, so I click on the ubuntu icon to get system??
ignore the system thing.  That's for 10.10 and down.  In 11.04 the update manager is on the left side (the unity bar) and it looks like a box with an orange arrow
thanks, and in the tutorial step 7 you must go to "7. Highlight Administration -> Hardware Drivers" where do i find this?
Upper left corner.  Power button -> system settings -> additional drivers
when I open "additional drivers" nothing shows up in the list...

That means that there are no proprietary drivers available for any of the hardware on your system.  Is your wifi kill switch on?  Perhaps the OS just didn't see your wifi card cause the switch was set to off.

no the light is on for the wifi driver. I have also installed "Wifi Radar" in the past, but it does not connect to any networks (Ive tested it on a few working networks" it tries to detect the dhcp settings, and sticks on the loading bar
Then I suspect your wifi card does not have any proprietary drivers written for linux
it worked in 10.10! im running acer aspire one netbook
There are probably open source drivers
what do you reccomend for getting the wifi to work? im seriously considering switching back to 10.04 LTS
